instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3662 no keyboard backlight.
threads.message:
Hi, 

Water damaged mac.

PPVOUT_S0_KBDBKLT  5V


BUt i compared with good working and see that  BKLT_KEYB1 and  BKLT_KEYB2 goes to 6-7 Volts when cover sensor near camera on display. But on this one it stais 0. Macos activated up down option for keyboard light control but there is no light. 


Already tried to change U7701 but same result

Any help?

threads.title: 820-3662 no keyboard backlight.
threads.message:
ALS from webcam is working?
KB control keys get disabled if you put flashlight on the webcam area directly?

threads.title: 820-3662 no keyboard backlight.
threads.message: Yeah, it is disabled when cover sensor, so it seems to work

threads.title: 820-3662 no keyboard backlight.
threads.message: Try known good keyboard backlight.

threads.title: 820-3662 no keyboard backlight.
threads.message:
Bought it yesterday, in couple of days will try.

but what exactly generate this line BKLT_KEYB1?

threads.title: 820-3662 no keyboard backlight.
threads.message:
KB and LCD backlight have both similar concept, based on boost-converter.
LCD has 6 return lines (BKL_ISEN_1-6) and KB only two (BKLT_KEYB1/2).
What voltages do you get at D7720?

threads.title: 820-3662 no keyboard backlight.
threads.message: D7720 get 5V on both points.

threads.title: 820-3662 no keyboard backlight.
threads.message: If D7720 is not shorted, try another keyboard backlight sheet...

threads.title: 820-3662 no keyboard backlight.
threads.message:
Got new keyboard backlight sheet. Still not working. Checked backlight sheet on other machine and it works. 

What else i can check?

threads.title: 820-3662 no keyboard backlight.
threads.message: D7720 not shorted for sure?

threads.title: 820-3662 no keyboard backlight.
threads.message: Yes. 5V on both ends. And no short there

threads.title: 820-3662 no keyboard backlight.
threads.message:
Q7701:
Pin 5 12V
Pin 4 - 2,7V
Pin 1-3  - 0V

It is BKL_SW . Is that normal? Must change q7701?


Also checked XW7720  and there is continuity

threads.title: 820-3662 no keyboard backlight.
threads.message:
I asked if D7720 is shorted; between its pins, of course.
How could I asked you about a short to ground if you already said to have 5V there???

"It is BKL_SW . Is that normal? Must change q7701?"
Why do you insist with LCD backlight???
I supposed you only miss KB backlight...

Check R7723/24/41/47.
Any voltage at C7747?
Also check connections between J4915 and KB backlight circuit.

threads.title: 820-3662 no keyboard backlight.
threads.message:
Ok. D7720 not shorted between pins.

Yes, Only miss keyboard backlight. LCD is ok.


R7741 is ok (32O Khms)

R7724/23 are 0.5 instead of 10 Ohms. But i measered on other board and it is also 0.3-0.5 so i think it is ok?

R7747 - 0.2 Ohms


C7747 has 0.8V

threads.title: 820-3662 no keyboard backlight.
threads.message:
0.8V is too low.
Do 2-3 PRAM resets and test again.

R7741 must be 32K aprox, not 320K.

threads.title: 820-3662 no keyboard backlight.
threads.message:
its 32 Kohm, i put O near 32. 


Done PRAM no result, Also done SMC RESET and NVRAM Reset. Same result.

threads.title: 820-3662 no keyboard backlight.
threads.message: Remove R7747 and run wire between C7742/47 pads.

threads.title: 820-3662 no keyboard backlight.
threads.message: You mean between Pad 2 of C7742 and Pad2 C7747 or create continuity between pad 1 and 2 of each component??

threads.title: 820-3662 no keyboard backlight.
threads.message: Do you really think that I said to short the pads to ground???

threads.title: 820-3662 no keyboard backlight.
threads.message: so you told me run wire between  C7742/47 not ground pads?

threads.title: 820-3662 no keyboard backlight.
threads.message:
May I need to (explicitly) say to force 3V at BKLT_PWM_KEYB???
Don't forget to remove R7747 first.

threads.title: 820-3662 no keyboard backlight.
threads.message:
Run wire and now there is 3.3 V but still no baclight. 


Also tried with new backlight sheet that 100% is working

threads.title: 820-3662 no keyboard backlight.
threads.message:
Change U7701 again.
Be sure about all solders, traces and surrounding components...

threads.title: 820-3662 no keyboard backlight.
threads.message: I dont have  LP8548B1SQ_-03  but jave  LP8548B1SQ_-04 put it and lcd backlight is gone now, keyboard backlight still not working. DO you know if 03 and 04 are compatible?

threads.title: 820-3662 no keyboard backlight.
threads.message:
No idea really, didn't swap it.

Are you really sure ALS is OK?

threads.title: 820-3662 no keyboard backlight.
threads.message:
What is ALS?

swapped from 820-4924 (04 version) and backlight on display is back, but still no on keyboard. Its nightmare this board.

threads.title: 820-3662 no keyboard backlight.
threads.message:
Ambient Light Sensor.
Be sure it works properly.
Check if LCD backlight reacts when you tap the webcam.

threads.title: 820-3662 no keyboard backlight.
threads.message: WIll try tomorrow, anyway i tried with other display and was same result. Tomorrow will post about ALS, thanks

threads.title: 820-3662 no keyboard backlight.
threads.message: Checked sensor and display brightness going up and down when flash with light near camera, so it is working.

threads.title: 820-3662 no keyboard backlight.
threads.message: I found donor with U7701 Rev 03 version. Put it. Now when it boot while bing keyboard light flashing once. but after that it doesnt turn on again,

threads.title: 820-3662 no keyboard backlight.
threads.message:
Seems that KB backlight circuit starts and overload is triggered.
Check again signals corresponding to KB backlight section.
Change all caps and L/D7720.

threads.title: 820-3662 no keyboard backlight.
threads.message:
I checked it again and nothing can be found. I removed wire and put back R7747 and now again not blinking.


al caps: C7724/25/23/26/27/20 has been changed. L7720 and D7720 also changed today (before your message)

threads.title: 820-3662 no keyboard backlight.
threads.message: changed L7720 again and now it is working. i dont know exactly if it was just l7220 because i also changed U7701 again. Anyway i am sure that l7220 had continuity and there was 5V on both pins. Even if it was so may coil fail?

threads.title: 820-3662 no keyboard backlight.
threads.message: A coil is more than a simple wire in a buck-converter...

threads.title: 820-3662 no keyboard backlight.
threads.message: thank you :)

threads.title: 820-3662 no keyboard backlight.
threads.message:
I remember a friend who I helped online few months ago.
He had a problem with trackpad movement on 820-2915 board.
18.5V is required to work and he changed all in the corresponding area.
ALL, except L5801; guess which was the problem...

threads.title: 820-3662 no keyboard backlight.
threads.message: coil for sure. Any way to check coil is ok or not? or the only way is changing?

threads.title: 820-3662 no keyboard backlight.
threads.message:
Only LCR tester can help.
More easy to test changing the coil...
